title: Coronavirus mythbusters: Falsehoods about the disease also are going viral
content: The researchers found that, "high temperature and high relative humidity significantly reduce the transmission of COVID-19, respectively, even after controlling for population density and GDP per capita of cities," the researchers wrote in the paper, published in SSRN, formerly the Social Science Research Network, an international journal. The closely related SARS-CoV-1 virus that spread in 2003 was contained so quickly that not much data exists about how seasons affected it.
warning: Based on the content, title, language and advertisements on this page, it can be assumed that this page is credible!
